articles.title: Asia Stocks Seen Higher as Fed Cut Momentum Builds: Markets Wrap - Bloomberg.com
articles.description: The yen rose the most in almost two weeks after US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said he expected Japan to raise interest rates to tame inflation. Asian stocks declined after a three-day rally.

articles.title: CNBC Daily Open: Despite cooler-than-expected CPI, economists agree higher prices are coming - CNBC
articles.description: Wall Street economists are expecting inflation to reaccelerate because of tariffs. Of course, a consensus view does not mean predictions will come true.

articles.title: Trump Has Resorted To Making Numbers Up — And Experts Say It Should Worry All Of Us - HuffPost
articles.description: The president is eliminating top government statisticians and data collection efforts he doesn’t like, raising alarms about the harm he could do to the U.S. economy.

articles.title: Cisco Stock Drops After Earnings - Barron's
Florida AG announces ban on "7-OH" products - Axios
articles.description: The announcement makes Florida the first state to ban the concentrated kratom byproduct.

articles.title: Air Canada to begin cancelling flights Thursday ahead of possible strike by its flight attendants - CBS News
articles.description: Air Canada says cancelling flights will allow for an orderly shutdown of operations in case of a strike.

articles.title: Stock Market Today: Dow Rockets 400 Points; S&P, Nasdaq Extend Rally On Rates Hopes To New Highs; Crypto Stock Catapults - Investor's Business Daily
articles.description: Stock Market Today: The Dow Jones index rose Wednesday. But Nvidia-backed CoreWeave and Cava stock plunged on earnings.

articles.title: Top Federal Reserve official signals uncertainty over September interest rate cut - Financial Times
articles.description: Hawkish tone from Austan Goolsbee contrasts with market expectations for reduction next month

articles.title: Why a jumbo Fed rate cut in September would ‘come across as panicky’ - MarketWatch
articles.description: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent says the Federal Reserve should drastically slash rates. Wall Street isn’t so sure.

articles.title: Crypto Firm Bullish Soars 84% in Debut After $1.1 Billion IPO - Bloomberg.com
articles.description: Bullish shares jumped 84% from the IPO price after the digital-asset exchange operator and owner of media outlet CoinDesk raised $1.1 billion in an initial public offering.

articles.title: 145-year-old film company Kodak pushes back on reports it may shut down - ABC News
AI startup Perplexity is raising more money at a $20 billion valuation - Business Insider
articles.description: AI startup Perplexity's valuation rose to $20 billion in fresh funding talks. It's a $2 billion jump from its last fundraise in July.

articles.title: Amazon expands its perishable delivery service, putting pressure on traditional grocers - AP News
articles.description: Amazon is now rolling out a service where its Prime members can order their blueberries and milk at the same time as their batteries and other basic items. The online juggernaut said Wednesday that customers in more than 1,000 cities and towns now have access…

articles.title: Casual Dining Takes A Hit: Stocks to Watch - Barron's
Gildan to Buy Hanesbrands for $2.2 Billion - The Wall Street Journal
articles.description: Canadian garment company said the acquisition will expand its scale and strengthen its global positioning.

articles.title: New York claims Zelle’s shoddy security enabled a billion dollars in scams - The Verge
articles.description: New York Attorney General Letitia James is suing the banks behind Zelle over claims that they failed to adopt safeguards against fraud, leading to scammers stealing more than $1 billion from consumers.

articles.title: Port of Los Angeles broke a century-old record as tariff threats triggered import surge - CNBC
articles.description: Port of LA handled 1M TEUs in July as importers rushed to beat Trump’s China tariffs, pushing volumes to all-time highs.

articles.title: Switzerland warns its companies that no, they can't dodge Trump's tariffs by routing goods through the tiny neighboring country of Liechtenstein - Fortune
articles.description: The two neighbors have had a century-long treaty allowing Liechtenstein to share Switzerland’s economic area and engage in free trade.

articles.title: Trump Signals He’ll Announce Fed Chair Pick ‘A Little Bit Early’ - Bloomberg.com
articles.description: President Donald Trump said he may name the next Federal Reserve chair “a little bit early” and added that he was down to three or four potential candidates as he looks for a successor to Jerome Powell.
